title: Bourbon Street shooting victim tells TV station he's done with New Orleans
content:
A 22-year-old man who was shot in the knee Sunday morning (Nov. 27) on Bourbon Street told WWL-TV he won't be returning for any more visits to New Orleans.
Ben Allison, of Eunice, talked to WWL from his hospital bed at University Medical Center, where he is being treated.
"The pain happened right away. Like, it feels like an ax, like you hitting a tree with an ax," he said.
As of Sunday afternoon (Nov. 27, 2016), the NOPD is investigating two unnamed suspects in the shooting, police said.
He was one of 10 people shot when New Orleans police say two people opened fire near the intersection of Bourbon and Iberville streets around 1:30 a.m Sunday. One person -- Demontris Toliver of Baton Rouge -- was killed.
New Orleans police are still searching for two suspected gunmen believed to have opened fire during an argument on Bourbon. None of the 10 people hit by bullets are believed to have been the intended targets, NOPD Superintendent Michael Harrison said Sunday.
